articles.author: Steven Erlanger
articles.title: Poland Gets Support From Europe on Tough Borders - The New York Times
articles.description: Faced with the weaponization of migrants from Belarus, the European Union is defending Poland’s hard line even as it withholds funds over rule of law violations.
articles.content: The crisis began in late August, when growing groups of migrants, mostly from the Middle East, began massing at the borders of Poland, Latvia and Lithuania, shepherded there by Belarus. That movement… [+903 chars]

articles.title: Germany accuses Belarus of 'state-run smuggling' amid migrant crisis - CBC.ca
articles.description: The German government on Wednesday accused Belarus of "state-run smuggling and trafficking" of human lives by luring desperate migrants to the Polish border — the edge of the European Union — where many are now stuck in makeshift camps in freezing weather.
articles.content: The German government on Wednesday accused Belarus of "state-run smuggling and trafficking" of human lives by luring desperate migrants to the Polish border the edge of the European Union where many … [+7127 chars]

articles.title: UK recovery is on track to outpace the eurozone – despite Brexit - Telegraph.co.uk
articles.description: Britain and Europe are both being impacted by supply issues and rising inflation, but there's plenty of evidence to show the EU is worse off
articles.content: There are other, non-Brexit factors at play too. UK growth was held back over the summer by the "pingdemic", which is now over. The new tax rules for agency workers, known as IR35, contributed to the… [+1304 chars]
